Package javaslang.algebra

Algebraic interfaces used to describe inherent class properties like Monad.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CheckedFunctor<T>
    Defines a CheckedFunctor by generalizing the map.
    CheckedMonad<T,M extends HigherKinded<?,M>>
    Defines a CheckedMonad by generalizing the flatMap function.
    Functor<T>
    Defines a Functor by generalizing the map.
    HigherKinded<T,TYPE extends HigherKinded<?,TYPE>>
    The HigherKinded type declares a generic type constructor, which consists of on component type and one container type.
    Monad<T,M extends HigherKinded<?,M>>
    Defines a Monad by generalizing the flatMap function.
    Monoid<A>
    A Monoid is a Semigroup (types with an associative binary operation) that has an identity element zero.
    Semigroup<A>
    A Semigroup is a type with an associative binary operation combine(Object, Object).

Package javaslang.algebra Description

Algebraic interfaces used to describe inherent class properties like Monad.

Interfaces like HigherKinded are needed to enhance API design and are mainly used internally by Javaslang. An example for Monoid usage is Traversable.foldMap(javaslang.algebra.Monoid, java.util.function.Function).

Since:
1.1.0
